Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness, consideration of gender-based persecution
Evidence_Type: Evidence of Roma ethnicity, domestic violence, gender-based persecution
Basis_of_Claim: Roma ethnicity, domestic violence, gender-based persecution
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to consider evidence, hostile hearing environment
Application_Error: Failure to address submitted evidence, inappropriate questioning
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness, duty to consider all grounds of persecution
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Board must consider all grounds of persecution supported by evidence, even if not explicitly stated
Outcome_of_Review: Case referred back for reconsideration by a different Board member
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient consideration of gender-based persecution and hostile hearing conduct
Evidentiary_Issues: Relevant evidence not addressed, improper questioning affecting testimony
Procedural_Fairness: Board created hostile environment, failed to ask relevant questions
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and misapplication of legal standards
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), principles of procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Hostile hearing atmosphere, failure to explore key aspects of claim
Omission_Type: Failure to consider evidence of domestic violence and gender-based persecution
